location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘Proposed Reservation for Refinery, Water Wells & Lines to Sitra. SK-120/1’

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:309 x 559 mm, on sheet 331 x 582 mm

mods.abstract: Distinctive Features:Blueprint sketch map dated 7 November 1936 produced by the Bahrein Petroleum Company, enclosed with a letter no. C/560-10/1. This is an updated edition of the map SK-120 dated 3 January 1936 (copy at IOR/R/15/1/662, f 50).Shows the extent of the various plots of land designated for the refinery site at Sitrah, Bahrain, including an area near Malamir with water wells marked and the 263 acres of added ground south-west of the present parcel. Indicates the location of two 100 feet wide strips of land, one designed for a direct road from the refinery to the Sitra Pier for use in shipping, and another, of the marshland east of the refinery intended as a drainage ditch.
